definitions.definition: The state of forgetting completely, of being oblivious , unconscious , unaware , as when sleeping, drunk, or dead.
examples: He regularly drank himself into oblivion .
Only the oblivion of sleep can heal the greatest traumas.

definitions.definition: The state of being completely forgotten , of being reduced to a state of non-existence , extinction , or nothingness , including through war and destruction. ( Figuratively ) for an area like hell , a wasteland .
examples: Due to modern technology, many more people and much more information will not slip into oblivion , contrary to what happened throughout history until now.
They tried to bomb them into oblivion .
I will cast them into oblivion !

main_definition: The state of forgetting completely, of being oblivious , unconscious , unaware , as when sleeping, drunk, or dead.
secondary_definitions: The state of being completely forgotten , of being reduced to a state of non-existence , extinction , or nothingness , including through war and destruction. ( Figuratively ) for an area like hell , a wasteland .
